items.name: Carian Greatsword
items.effect: Performs sweeping slash using magical greatsword
items.lore: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family. Conjures a magic greatsword and then delivers a sweeping blow. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly. Armed with this spell, sorcerers gain the strength of knights, their loyalty sworn to the moon.
items.desc: A massive magical greatsword springs from the tip of your staff. When the sword appears, you make a melee spell attack against a target of your choice within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes 2d12 force damage. Until the spell ends, you can use an action to repeat this attack against the same target or a different one.

items.name: Carian Phalanx
items.effect: Forms a defensive arch of numerous magic glintblades
items.lore: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family. Creates a defensive arch of numerous magic glintblades overhead, which automatically attack nearby foes. This sorcery can be used cast while in motion. An enhanced version of the glintblade sorcery used by enchanted knights.
items.desc: Numerous glintblades form around you. When the swords appear, you make a ranged spell attack against a target of your choice within range. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 force damage. You may use a bonus action to make an additional attack at the same target or a different one. On subsequent turns, you may use an action and/or a bonus action to make additional attacks with the blades.

items.name: Carian Piercer
items.effect: Impales foes with magical greatsword
items.lore: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family. Conjures a magic greatsword to impale foes. Charging lengthens the initial step in. This sorcery forms a counterpart to Carian Greatsword. Highly lethal when used against single foes riding alone.
items.desc: A magical greatsword springs from your staff, striking at creatures in a line of 15 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 4d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Carian Retaliation
items.effect: Dispels enemy spells and retaliates with glintblades
items.casting_time: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a creature within 60 targeting you with a spell
items.lore: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family. Swing your staff to dispel incoming sorceries and incantations, using their power to retaliate with glintblades. This was the Carian royal family's secret means to prepare against the disloyalty of the academy. The moon and stars would one day go their separate ways.
items.desc: You quickly wave your staff in front of you, conjuring a pool of magic to intercept an effect targetting you. If the spell is an attack, the attack against you is made at disadvantage. If it requires a saving throw, you gain advantage on the save. If the attack misses or you pass the save, a glintblade springs into being in front of you. The glintblade flies at the spell's caster in retaliation. Make a ranged spell attack at the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 force damage.

items.name: Carian Slicer
items.effect: Performs swift sweeping slash using magical sword
items.lore: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family. Conjures a magic sword and delivers a swift sweeping slash. This sorcery can be used without delay after performing anotheraction. Even among the Carian sword sorceries, this is a notably effective technique.
items.desc: A magical shortsword springs from the tip of your staff. When the sword appears, you make a melee spell attack against a target of your choice within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 force damage. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action to repeat this attack against the same target or a different one.

items.name: Collapsing Stars
items.effect: Pulls foes toward caster with gravity projectile volley
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces. Fires numerous gravitational projectiles. Any foes struck will be pulled toward the caster. Charging enhances potency. A gravitational technique mastered by the young Radahn. "I thank you for your tutelage, for now I can challenge the stars. "
items.desc: Spheres of gravitational magic spring from your staff, launching towards a creature within range. The target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 8d8 bludgeoning damage on a failed save and is dragged fifteen feet towards you. A creature takes half as much damage on a successful save and is not dragged.

items.name: Comet
items.effect: Fires a great magic comet
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires a great magical comet. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Chargingenhances potency. The greatest of the Karolos Conspectus's sorceries, that only avery few sorcerers have ever mastered.
items.desc: Glintstone energy collects at the tip of your staff, which you then project towards a creature or object in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 5d12 force damage.

items.name: Comet Azur
items.effect: Fires a tremendous comet within a starry torrent
items.lore: Legendary sorcery devised by Azur, primeval sorcerer. Fires a tremendous comet in a torrent akin to the distant starry expanse, the place said to be the origin of glintstone. Hold to continue releasing the sorcery's power. When Azur glimpsed into the primeval current, he saw darkness. He was left both bewitched and fearful of the abyss.
items.desc: You gaze into the abyss between the stars for just a moment, projecting your vision into a mighty beam in the form of a line 10 feet wide and 120 feet long. Any creature caught in the beam takes 10d10 force damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, it is disintegrated. Any creature that enters the beam or ends its turn within it takes the same damage.

items.name: Crystal Barrage
items.effect: Fires a volley of glintstone crystal shards
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires a volley of glintstone crystal shards. Charging increases potency. A sorcery of the Crystal Cadre, a group of sorcerers who pursue the wisdom of stone - the secrets locked in the faint cogitation of the Crystalians.
items.desc: Glintstone collects at the tip of your staff, bursting forth in a line five feet wide and 20 feet long. Until the spell ends, the creature can use an action change the direction of the line. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Crystal Burst
items.effect: Fires a burst of glintstone crystal shards
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires a burst of glintstone crystal shards. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging increases potency. A sorcery of the Crystal Cadre, a group of sorcerers who pursued the wisdom of stone - the secrets locked in the faint cogitation of the Crystalians.
items.desc: Glintstone crystals collect in your staff and explode in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d8 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Crystal Release
items.effect: Scours area with violent rain of crystal shards
items.lore: Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians. Creates a mass of crystal, then shatters it to scour a wide area with a violent rain of crystal shards. This sorcery is used by high-ranking adepts among the Crystalians. Some also call this sorcery "the Crystal Sun. "
items.desc: Glinstone crystals collect in a mass above your head, rising into the air and exploding downwards in a 10-foot radius circle around you. Each creature in that area other than you must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d8 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Crystal Torrent
items.effect: Creates crystal mass that fires stream of crystal shards
items.lore: Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians. Creates a mass of crystal, then fires off shards in rapid succession. Hold to continue firing shards. The wrath of the Crystalians encapsulated in sorcery. Each shard is of substantial size, making even a stray blow capable of inflicting a severe wound. Â
items.desc: Glintstone crystals collect in your staff burst forth in a line 5 feet wide and 30 feet long. For the duration, you may use an action to change the direction the line. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d8 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Eternal Darkness
items.effect: Creates a dark space that draws in spells
items.lore: Forbidden sorcery of Sellia, Town of Sorcery. Creates a space of darkness that draws in sorceries andincantations. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Originally a lost sorcery of the Eternal City; the despair thatbrought about its ruin made manifest.
items.desc: Dark magic collects in a 5-foot wide sphere that hovers ten feet above the point you cast this spell. Any spell attack made against a creature within 15 feet of the sphere target the sphere instead. Creatures in the same area have advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws against spell effects in the area.

items.name: Explosive Ghostflame
items.effect: Causes ghostflame explosion that burns wide area
items.lore: Sorcery of the servants of Death. Strike the ground with the staff, triggering an explosion of ghostflame that burns the surrounding area. In the time when there was no Erdtree, death was burned in ghostflame. Deathbirds were the keepers of that fire.
items.desc: You conjure the cursemark of death above your head, drawing it down with your staff and slamming it into the ground. Ghostflame explodes in a 15-foot radius sphere around you. Each creature other than yourself caught in the explosion must make a Constitution saving throw taking 8d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Five 5 foot wide long 20 foot long lines then burst from the edge of the explosion and trace along the ground. The lines cannot overlap with each other. Each creature standing in the line not caught in the original explosion must succeed on a Constitution save. A target takes 4d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Fia's Mist
items.effect: Release a mist of death before caster
items.lore: Sorcery of Fia, the Deathbed Companion. Creates a deathly mist before the caster, which inflicts Death blight upon those who enter. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances range of the mist. This sorcery was developed to oppose the Roundtable Hold, and is effective only against the Tarnished.
items.desc: You create a 10-foot-radius sphere of deathfog centered on a point within range. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is lightly obscured. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 4d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Founding Rain of Stars
items.effect: Releases a downpour of star rain for a while
items.lore: The eldest primeval sorcery, said to have been discovered by anancient astrologer. A sorcery of legendary status. Summons a dark cloud of stars overhead. Shortly after, the cloudwill release a violent deluge of star rain. This sorcery can be castwhile in motion. Charging increases potency. Thought to be the founding glintstone sorcery. The glimpse of theprimeval current that the astrologer saw became real, and thestars' amber rained down on this land.
items.desc:
Gazing into your staff, your glimpse the primeval current and create a cloud of glintstone in the form of a cylinder 15 feet tall with a 30-foot radius. When you cast the spell and at the beginning of each of your turns while the spell is active a rain of glinstone bombards the ground underneath the cloud. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 10d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you may use an action to move the cloud up to 30 feet to a point within range.

items.name: Freezing Mist
items.effect: Releases cold mist before caster
items.lore: Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch. Releases a cold mist before the caster. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances range of the mist. The snowy crone taught the young Ranni to fear the dark moon as she imparted her cold sorcery.
items.desc: You create a 10-foot-radius sphere of freezing mist centered on a point within range. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is lightly obscured. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 4d8 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Frozen Armament
items.effect: Enchants right-hand armament with frost
items.lore: Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch. Enchants armament held in the right hand with frost. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. The snowy crone taught the young Ranni to fear the dark moon as she imparted her cold sorcery.
items.desc: You touch a weapon that deals only physical damage. Until the spell ends, that weapon becomes a magic weapon that deals an additional 1d8 cold damage.

items.name: Gavel of Haima
items.effect: Attacks using a magic greathammer
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Creates a magical greathammer and slams it down. Allows one follow-up attack. Drawn from the scholarly conspectus of Haima, the adjudicator of the academy, this sorcery employs might as a means to quell conflict.
items.desc: You conjure a magical greathammer from your staff, slamming it down on a creature within range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d10 force damage. The hammer then detonates in a 5-foot radius sphere centered on the target. Each creature in the area except for you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 2d8 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

items.name: Gelmir's Fury
items.effect: Covers area with surge of magma from the earth
items.lore: One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir. Conjures a surge of magma from the earth, covering the area. Charging extends the surge of magma. This sorcery is held to represent the fury of the volcano, but thearrogance of attempting to harness it is solely that of men andserpents.
items.desc:
A volcanic eruption bursts forth as you slam your staff into the ground. Magma sprays in a 30-foot radius around you. Each creature in the area other than you must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 12d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The magma in the area lingers until the end of your next turn. The area is difficult terrain until the magma dissipates. Any creature that ends its turn in the magma takes 6d6 fire damage.

items.name: Glintblade Phalanx
items.effect: Forms a defensive arch of magic glintblades
items.lore: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family. Creates a defensive arch of magic glintblades overhead, whichautomatically attack nearby foes. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Bestowed upon the enchanted Carian knights, who combined thisart with their swordsmanship to maintain pressure upon theirfoes, striking in waves of steel and sorcery.
items.desc: Three glintblades hover in an arc around you. As a bonus action on your turns, you may send a glintblade towards a target in range, making a ranged spell attack it. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 force damage. The spell ends when no glintblades remain.

items.name: Glintstone Arc
items.effect: Launches a horizontally-widening magic arc
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires a horizontal arc of magic that spreads outward. This sorcery can be cast repeteadly and while in motion. Granted to sorcererers who depart from the academy to embark onjourneys, in order to fend off large groups of would-be adversaries. Fools often roam in packs.
items.desc: Wave your staff in front of you and create an arc of glinstone mage. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 4d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Glintstone Cometshard
items.effect: Fires a magic comet with a trailing tail
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires a magical comet with a trailing tail. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging enhances potency. A sorcery of the Karolos Conspectus, the most venerable of the academy.
items.desc: A large shard of glintstone magic launches from your staff toward a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 3d10 force damage.

items.name: Glintstone Icecrag
items.effect: Fires mass of cold magic from glintstone
items.lore: Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch. The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching a mass of cold magic. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. The snowy crone taught the young Ranni to fear the dark moonas she imparted her cold sorcery.
items.desc: You collect cold magic in your staff, combining it with a mass of glintstone that you launch towards a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 cold damage and 3d6 force damage.

items.name: Glintstone Pebble
items.effect: Fires magic projectiles from glintstone
items.lore: The most basic glintstone sorcery of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching magical projectiles at foes. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. This is a universal first step on the journey to true knowledge of sorcery.
items.desc:
A tiny mote of glintstone magic launches from your staff towards a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 force damage.

This spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th Level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

items.name: Glintstone Stars
items.effect: Fires guided magic shooting stars
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires three magic shooting stars that pursue the target. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhancespotency. A sorcery of the Olivinus Conspectus, which attracts sorcerers from Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
items.desc: Imbue glintstone with your will, letting them free so they may pursue your a foe within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 3d6 force damage. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and suffers none of the spellâ€™s other effects

items.name: Gravity Well
items.effect: Pulls foes toward caster with gravity projectile
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces. Fires a projectile of condensed gravitational force. Those struck by it will be pulled toward the caster. Charging enhances potency. A gravitational technique studied by the young Radahn. His master was an Alabaster Lord with skin of stone.
items.desc: Conjure a chunk of glintstone imbued with gravitational magic at a creature within range. The target must make a Strength saving throw. A target takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage and is pulled 10 feet toward you. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not pulled.

items.name: Great Glintstone Shard
items.effect: Fires larger magic projectiles from glintstone
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching large magical projectiles at foes. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Those unworthy of the stone crown typically end their brief journey into sorcery here.
items.desc: A large shard of glintstone magic launches from your staff towards a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 3d10 force damage.

items.name: Great Oracular Bubble
items.effect: Launches a large magic bubble
items.lore: Sorcery of the claymen who served as priests in the ancient dynasty. Produces a gigantic magical bubble that drifts towards foes before it naturally ruptures. Â Charging increases the delay before the bubble pops. The claymen search for lost oracles within their bubbles.
items.desc: Thinking on a prophecy heard long ago, you conjure a bubble of magic in a 5-foot radius sphere. The bubble drifts 15 feet towards a point you choose within range. The bubble moves an additional 15 feet at the beginning of each of your turns. When the spell ends, the bubble reaches its destination, or it collides with a creature or object, the bubble pops in a 10-foot radius burst. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 6d6 force damage.

items.name: Greatblade Phalanx
items.effect: Forms a defensive arch of larger magic glintblades
items.lore: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family. Creates a defensive arch of larger magic glintblades overhead, which automatically attack nearby foes. Used by the enchanted troll knights. They were the comrades of the young Rennala, bound by oath.
items.desc: Three massive glintblades hover in an arc around you. As a bonus action on your turns, you may send a glintblade towards a target in range, making a ranged spell attack it. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 force damage. The spell ends when no glintblades remain.

items.name: Loretta's Greatbow
items.effect: Fires great arrow from a magic greatbow
items.lore: Sorcery used by Royal Knight Loretta. Creates a magic greatbow and fires a great arrow. Charging enhances potency. Hold to keep the great arrow nocked. It is said that the bow was Loretta's favored weapon.
items.desc: Conjure a massive magical greatbow and fire an arcane projectile at a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 10d6 force damage.

items.name: Loretta's Mastery
items.effect: Fires four great arrow from a magic greatbow at once
items.lore: Sorcery used by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree. Creates a magic greatbow and fires four great arrows simultaneously. Charging enhances potency. Hold to keep the great arrows nocked. Developed by Loretta after her long, bloody journey to seek out a place where the Albinaurics could live in peace.
items.desc: Conjure a massive magical greatbow and fire four arcane projectile at targets within range. Each arrow can target the same creature, different creatures, or combinations thereof. For each arrow, make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 8d6 force damage.

items.name: Lucidity
items.effect: Alleviates buildup of sleep and madness
items.lore: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family. Alleviates buildup of sleep and madness. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. The Carian knights never waver.
items.desc: For the duration, the willing creature you touch has advantage on saving throws against sleep or frenzy effects.

items.name: Magic Downpour
items.effect: Summon a magic mass that sprays projectiles over area
items.lore: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family. Summons a mass of magic that fires projectiles over a wide area. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging extendsduration. Said to have been taught by the Crystalians to mark the swearingof the old concord.
items.desc: Conjure a mass of magic that hovers 20-feet above a point on the ground within range. The mass then projects a 30-foot cone of magic stars from itself. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. a target takes 4d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On subsequent turns for the duration of the spell, you may use an action to create another cone of stars.

items.name: Magic Glintblade
items.effect: Creates sigil that forms a projectile glintblade after delay
items.lore: An old sorcery of the Carian Royal Family. Creates a sigil overhead, from which an enemy-seeking glintblade appears after a brief delay. Â This sorcery can be used while in motion. Â Charging increases the delay. Â Said to be the prototype of the sword-phalanx soerceries wielded by royal enchanted knights
items.desc: Conjure the Carian Sigil in an adjacent space. The sigil hovers in the air until the beginning of your next turn when it transforms into a glintstone blade. When it transforms, choose a creature within range of the blade and make a ranged spell attack against it On a hit, the target takes 4d6 force damage.

items.name: Magma Shot
items.effect: Fires lump of magma that explodes on contact
items.lore: One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir. Fires a lump of magma that explodes on contact. Â Charging enhances potency. After discovering the ancient hexes of Gelmir, Rykard, son of Queen Rennala, brought them back into practical use as new forms of sorcery.
items.desc:
Hurl a lump of magma at a point within range, which explodes in a 5-foot radius sphere. Each creature in the area other than you must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 5d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The magma in the area lingers until the end of your next turn. The area is difficult terrain until the magma dissipates. Any creature that ends its turn in the magma takes 4d6 fire damage.

items.name: Meteorite
items.effect: Calls small meteors down from the sky
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces. Summons a void that emits aÂ rain of small meteorites. Hold to continue the effect. The sorcery originates from the Onyx Lords, who had skin of stone, and were called lords in reverential fear of their destructive power.
items.desc: A tear in space appears overhead, summoning meteorites from the depths of space.

items.name: Meteorite of Astel
items.effect: Calls a hail of small meteorites from the void.
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces. Summons a void that emits a hail of meteorites. Hold to continue the effect. A manifestation of the power with which Astel leveled the Eternal City.
items.desc:
Astelâ€™s cry shakes the earth as a massive tear in space appears overhead. Five meteors are summoned, which you can direct to crash into different points within range. The meteorites explode in 10-foot radius spheres when they land. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 12d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Targets only take damage from a single meteor each time the spell is cast.

As a bonus action on subsequent turns while the spell is active, you may summon another meteor from the tear that acts in the same manner as the previous ones.

items.name: Night Comet
items.effect: Fires a semi-invisible magic comet
items.lore: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery. Fires a semi-invisible magic comet. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging enhances potency. The Sellian sorcerers were assassins, and it is said that they often hunted their fellows.
items.desc: A comet resembling the inky blackness of a starless sky fires from your staff at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d10 force damage. This attack is made at advantage if the caster is in dim light.

items.name: Night Maiden's Mist
items.effect: Releases life-sapping silver mist before caster
items.lore: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery. Releases a life-sapping silver mist before the caster, dealingdamage to all caught within, including the caster. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Below Sellia, the Eternal City of Nokron sleeps. This sorceryoriginates from the maiden of that place.
items.desc: You create a 10-foot-radius sphere of silver mist centered on a point within range. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is lightly obscured. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 4d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The caster regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt. Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.

items.name: Night Shard
items.effect: Swiftly fires a semi-invisible magic projectile
items.lore: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery. Swiftly fires a semi-invisible projectile. This sorcery can be used without delay after performing another action. The Sellian sorcerers were assassins, and it is said that they often hunted their fellows.
items.desc: A sliver of darkness fires from your staff at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 force damage. This attack is made at advantage if the caster is in dim light.

items.name: Oracle Bubbles
items.effect: Launches several small magic bubbles
items.lore: Sorcery of the claymen who served as priests in the ancientdynasty. Produces several small magical bubbles that drift towards foesÂ before they naturally pop. Charging increases the delay before the bubbles pop. The claymen search for lost oracles within their bubbles.
items.desc: Bubbles of prophecy float out of your staff, occupying a 5-foot cube within range. If the space is occupied by a creature, the bubbles pop and the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes 6d4 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The bubbles otherwise hover in space until a creature enters the area. The bubbles then pop and the creature makes the same saving throw.

items.name: Rancorcall
items.effect: Summons vengeful spirits that chase down foes
items.lore: SorceryÂ of the servants of Death. Summons vengeful spirits that chase down foes. Charging enhances potency. Â Once though lost, this ancient death hex was rediscovered by the necromancer Garris. Â
items.desc:
The vengeful spirits of Those Who Live in Death answer your call, chasing down a creature within range. The spirits appear in your space in a five-foot wide sphere, and moves 30 feet toward the target. At the beginning of each of your turns, the spirits move another 30 feet toward the target. When the spirits reach the target, it must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes 8d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The spell ends after the spirits reach the target or they have moved 120 feet

items.name: Ranni's Dark Moon
items.effect: Incarnate a cold, dark moon and launch it at foes.
items.lore: Legendary sorcery associated with the Carian queen. Â Uses the caster as a vessel to incarnate a cold, dark moon, then sends it floating toward foes. The dark moon dispels all sorcery that touches it, and temporarily reduces magic damage negation for those it strikes. This moon was encountered by a young Ranni, led by the hand of her mother, Rennala. What she beheld was cold, dark and veiled in occult mystery.
items.desc:
Picturing the Dark Moon of the Carian princess, you hover into the air and transform yourself into an effigy of the same dark moon. Until the beginning of your next turn, you are incapacitated and immune to damage from sorceries. You also automatically succeed on saving throws from sorcery spells. 

At the beginning of your next turn, the moon is launched at a creature within range while you drift safely down into the space you cast the spell. When the moon reaches the target, it explodes in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point. Each creature in the area must make a Wisdom saving throw. a target takes 10d10 cold damage and 10d10 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save also gain vulnerability to force damage and disadvantage on saving throws against sorceries for the next minute. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

items.name: Rennala's Full Moon
items.effect: Incarnate a full moon and launch it at foes
items.lore: Sorcery associated with the Carian queen. Uses the caster as a vessel to incarnate a full moon, then sends it floating toward foes. The full moon dispels all sorcery that touches it, and temporarily reduces magic damage negation for those it strikes. Queen Rennala encountered this enchanting moon when she was young, and later, it would bewitch the academy.
items.desc:
Picturing the Full Moon of the Carian queen, you hover into the air and transform yourself into an effigy of the same moon. Until the beginning of your next turn, you are incapacitated and immune to damage from sorceries. You also automatically succeed on saving throws from sorcery spells. 

At the beginning of your next turn, the moon is launched at a creature within range while you drift safely down into the space you cast the spell. When the moon reaches the target, it explodes in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point. Each creature in the area must make a Wisdom saving throw. a target takes 40d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save also gain vulnerability to force damage and disadvantage on saving throws against sorceries for the next minute. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

items.name: Rock Blaster
items.effect: Thrust staff into ground to emit a massive shockwave
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Imbues the ferrule of the caster's staff with magic, then thrusts itinto the ground to create a massive magical shockwave. Hold to continue moving without striking the ground, and thenpush the end of the staff into enemies. An enhanced version of the glintstone miners' Stonediggersorcery.
items.desc: The base of your staff charges with glintstone magic, slamming into the ground and blasting the ground around you. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius circle around you must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 5d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Rock Sling
items.effect: Summons rocks from the earth and sends its flying
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces. Â Pulls a clump of rocks from the earth and sends them flying. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. A gravitational technique studied by the young Radahn. His master was an Alabaster Lord with skin of stone. Â
items.desc: You seize nearby rock and debris with gravity magic, hurling them towards your quaries. You can control three projectiles, directing each towards one or more targets within range. make a ranged spell attack against each target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Roiling Magma
items.effect: Fires lump of magma that explodes after delay
items.lore: One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir. Fires a lump of condensed magma that explodes a short delay after hitting the target. Charging enhances potency and further delays the explosion. After discovering the ancient hexes of Gelmir, Rykard, son of Queen Rennala, brought them back into practical use as new forms of sorcery.
items.desc:
A beam of yellow light flashes from your pointing finger, then condenses to linger at a chosen point within range as a glowing bead for the Duration. When the spell ends, either because your Concentration is broken or because you decide to end it, the bead blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of magma. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes fire damage equal to the total accumulated damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The magma in the area lingers until the end of your next turn. The area is difficult terrain until the magma dissipates. Any creature that ends its turn in the magma takes 6d6 fire damage.

The spell's base damage is 10d6. If at the end of Your Turn the bead has not yet detonated, the damage increases by 1d6. The magma damage does not increase

items.name: Rykard's Rancor
items.effect: Releases searing spirits that repeatedly explode after delay
items.lore: The terrible power of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy. Â Summons searing spirits that leave a trail of delayed explosions in their wake. These spirits manifest from the rancor of heroes who met a violent end. The lord granted them an audience, whereupon they were welcomed by the maw of the great serpent -- and within the serpent's bowels, they became the lord's kin. Â
items.desc:
The howling souls of those consumed by the Great Serpent rise from your staff, pursuing a creature within range. The spirits appear in your space in a five-foot wide sphere, and moves 30 feet toward the target. At the beginning of each of your turns, the spirits move another 30 feet toward the target. When the spirits reach the target, it must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes 10d6 fire damage and 10d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The spell ends after the spirits reach the target or they have moved 120 feet. Whenever the spirits end their movement, they leave a fiery trail along the path they moved which explodes afterwards. Each creature within five feet of the trail must succeed on a Dexterity saving or take 8d6 fire damage.

items.name: Scholar's Armament
items.effect: Enchants right-hand armament with magic damage
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Enchants armaments held in the right hand with magic-affinity attacks. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Taught to the Knights of the Cuckoo by the academy as payment for their contract.
items.desc: You touch a weapon that deals only physical damage. Until the spell ends, that weapon becomes a magic weapon that deals an additional 1d8 force damage.

items.name: Scholar's Shield
items.effect: Enhances left-hand shield damage negation
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Enchants shield held in the left hand with additional damage negation. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Taught to the Knights of the Cuckoo by the academy as payment for their contract.
items.desc: You touch a nonmagical shield. Until the spell ends, that shield becomes a magic shield with a +1 bonus to AC while granting resistance to force damage for the wielder.

items.name: Shard Spiral
items.effect: Fire twin spiraling projectiles
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires twin projectiles that form a spiral as they travel. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging enhances potency. A sorcery of the Karolos Conspectus, the most venerable of the academy. This was the product of a failed attempt to create a new comet.
items.desc: Two mirrored glintstone shards rotate in a double helix in a line 5 feet wide and 30 feet long.  Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d8 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Shatter Earth
items.effect: Thrust staff into ground to emit a shockwave
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Imbues the ferrule of the caster's staff with magic, then thrusts it into the ground to create a magical shockwave. Allows one follow-up attack. A Stonedigger sorcery used by the glintstone miners of the crystal tunnel. At the academy, use of this sorcery was a stigma that marked out failed scholars.
items.desc: The base of your staff charges with glintstone magic, slamming into the ground and blasting the ground around you. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius circle around you must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 3d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Shattering Crystal
items.effect: Creates crystal mass that shatters in forward burst
items.lore: Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians. Creates a mass of crystal, then shatters it in a forward burst. Charging enhances potency. The Crystalians are inorganic beings, yet they live. They cleave close to the ideals of the primeval current, and as such, they are revered guests of the sorcerers.
items.desc: Massive glintstone crystals collect in your staff and explode in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 10d10 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Star Shower
items.effect: Fires six shooting stars that pursue foes
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires six magic shooting stars that pursue the target. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances potency. The most difficult to master of the Olivinus Conspectus sorceries.
items.desc: Imbue glintstone with your will, letting them free so they may pursue your a foe within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 8d6 force damage. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and suffers none of the spellâ€™s other effects.

items.name: Starlight
items.effect: Creates star light to illuminate surroundings
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Creates a small, floating star light that illuminates surroundings. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Granted to sorcerers who depart from the academy to embark on journeys. Even during the blackest nights, sojourns underground, or imprisonment in gaol, the stars are never far from a sorcerer's side. Â
items.desc: A mote of light hovers above your head until the spell ends, shedding bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

items.name: Stars of Ruin
items.effect: Fire twelve dark shooting stars that pursue foes
items.lore: Legendary sorcery devised by Lusat, primeval sorcerers. Â Fires twelve dark shooting stars that pursue the target. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging increases potency. When Lusat glimpsed into the primeval current, he beheld the final moments of a great star cluster, and upon seeing it, he too was broken. Â
items.desc: You create a barrage of stars to pursue a foe within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, the target takes no damage. On a failure, the target takes 5d8 force damage, plus an additional 1d8 damage equal to the difference between the target's save and your spell save DC, up to a maximum of 12d10 total damage. For instance, if your spell save DC is 18 and the target rolls a 15 on their Dexterity save, they would take 8d8 force damage.

items.name: Swift Glintstone Shard
items.effect: Swiftly fires magic projectiles from glintstone
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching swift magical projectiles at foes. This sorcery can be used without delay after performing another action. Those unworthy of the stone crown typically end their brief journey into sorcery here.
items.desc: You quickly create a shard of glintstone and launch it from your staff toward a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 force damage.

items.name: Terra Magica
items.effect: Raises the magic strength of those within the sigil
items.lore: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Draws an academy sigil upon the ground, raising the magic strength of those within. Once, the sigil would be cast from the highest belfry of the academy, covering the entire institution's grounds. This spell allows such vivid experience of spellâ€”casting success, it turns many a fledgling into a true sorcerer in a flash of newfound understanding.
items.desc: The sigil of the Academy of Raya Lucaria is summoned on the ground underneath you in a 10-foot radius circle. The spells of any creature of your choice that is standing within the circle are empowered. When an empowered creature rolls damage dice for a spell they cast within the circle, they can reroll any of the dice and take the higher total.

items.name: Thops's Barrier
items.effect: Erect a magic forcefield to deflect spells
items.lore: The lifelong pursuit of Thops the Bluntstone. Creates a magic forcefield that deflects sorceries and incantations. Hold to continuously create barriers. Future generations will learn. They will know the foolishness of the sneering sorcerers who ridiculed this theory, little realizing that it was in fact a discovery worthy of a new conspectus of the academy.
items.desc: Holding your staff aloft, you create a barrier in front of you that deflects magic until the beginning of your next turn. While the barrier is active, spell attack rolls against you have disadvantage and you have advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws against magic.

items.name: Tibia's Summons
items.effect: Summons Those Who Live in Death
items.lore: Sorcery of the servants of Death. Summons a group of Those Lost in Death. Three skeletons will appear some distance from the caster and attack foes before disappearing. The dead have long been left to wander; what they need is leadership.
items.desc: You entreat the souls of Those Who Live in Death, answering your call in the form of three skeletal spirits which attack a target in range. Make three melee spell attacks at the target. Each attack that hits the target deals 4d6 slashing damage.

items.name: Unseen Blade
items.effect: Makes right-hand armament completely invisible
items.lore: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery. Enchants armament held in right hand, making it completely invisible. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Used by Sellian assassins to present themselves as unarmed sorcerers.
items.desc: You mask a weapon in night magic, obscuring it in the hand of the wielder. The next attack made with the invisible weapon before the spell ends is made at advantage.

items.name: Unseen Form
items.effect: Makes the caster semi-invisible
items.lore: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery. Makes the caster semi-invisible. While on horseback, effect extends to cover the mount. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. The Sellian assassins considered every option that aided their dirty work.
items.desc: A creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the targetâ€™s person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

items.name: Zamor Ice Storm
items.effect: Thrust staff into ground to create freezing tornado
items.lore: Ice sorcery of the Town of Zamor. Strike the ground with the staff to create a freezing tornado. Charging enhances potency. Cloaked in icy tempests, the knights of Zamor have challenged the Fire Giants since ancient times.
items.desc:
A whirlwind of freezing air surrounds you for the spell's duration in a 15-foot radius 50-foot high cylinder. The area of the whirlwind is difficult terrain. A creature must make a Dexterity saving throw the first time on a turn that it enters the whirlwind or that the whirlwind enters its space, including when the whirlwind first appears. A creature takes 8d6 bludgeoning damage and 8d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

When you create the storm, you can choose whether to have it draw creatures into the storm or force them out. If you choose the former, creatures within the area of the whirlwind must succeed on a Strength saving throw at the beginning of their turns or be dragged to a free space adjacent to you. If you choose the latter, creatures within the whirlwind must make the same save or be pushed to the edge of the storm.

items.name: Stamp (Upward Cut)
items.applicable_arms: Greatswords, Colossal Swords, Curved Greatswords, Heavy Thrusting Swords, Hammers, Great Hammers, Axes, Greataxes, Flails, Colossal Weapons
items.lore: Brace armament and step into a low stance that prevents recoil from most enemy attacks. Follow up with a strong attack for an upward strike.
items.description: You stomp on the ground, kicking up dust and bracing yourself. For the duration, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being knocked prone or shoved. As an action while you are braced, you can make an attack roll at disadvantage at up to two creatures in range.

items.name: Quickstep
items.applicable_arms: All melee armaments
items.lore: Skill prized by the crafty and fleet of foot. Perform a quickstep maneuver that allows for circling around lock-on targets.
items.description: You move up to 5 feet in any direction without provoking attacks of opportunity.

items.name: Barbaric Roar
items.applicable_arms: Usable on melee armaments (daggers, thrusting swords, and whips excepted)
items.lore: Let loose a bestial roar to rally the spirit and increase attack power. While active, strong attacks change to savage combo attacks.
items.description: You bellow a bestial roar, bolstering yourself. For a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus, your attack and damage rolls with Heavy weapons are increased by 1.

items.name: Square Off
items.applicable_arms: Usable on melee armaments (daggers, thrusting swords, and whips excepted)
items.lore: This skill starts with the sword held level. Follow up with a normal attack to slash upwards through enemy's guard, or a strong attack to perform a running thrust."
items.description: You enter a prepared stance until the beginning of your next turn. While prepared, you may make an attack of opportunity against any creature who enters your reach.

items.name: Kick
items.applicable_arms: All melee armaments
items.lore: Push an enemy back with a high kick. Effective against enemies who are guarding, and can break a foe's stance. Sometimes a simple tool is the most effective.
items.description: While wielding this weapon, you have advantage on shove attacks made to push an enemy 5 feet away from you.

items.name: Wild Strikes
items.applicable_arms: Greatswords, Curved Swords, Curved Greatswords, Hammers, Great Hammers, Axes, Greataxes, Flails
items.lore: Swing armament with wild abandon. Hold to continue swinging. Can be followed up with a normal or strong attack.
items.description: When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

items.name: Impaling Thrust
items.applicable_arms: Daggers, Straight Swords, Greatswords, Katanas, Twinblades, Thrusting Swords, Heavy Thrusting Swords, Spears, Great Spears, Halberds, Claws
items.lore: Skill that lets piercing armaments overcome enemy shields. Build power, then lunge forward for a strong thrust that pierces an enemy's guard.
items.description: You keenly thrust your blade between an opponent's guard. Until the beginning of your next turn, attacks you make with this weapon ignore the AC bonus of shields the target wields.

items.name: Spinning Slash
items.applicable_arms: Daggers, Straight Swords, Greatswords, Curved Swords, Curved Greatswords, Katanas, Twinblades, Axes, Greataxes, Spears, Great Spears, Halberds, Reapers
items.lore: Skill favored by dexterous warriors. Slash foes as your body spins. Additional input allows for a follow-up attack.
items.description: You spin your blade in a circle around you, attacking a number of separate targets equal to your proficiency modifier. These attacks are made at disadvantage.

items.name: Unsheathe
items.applicable_arms: Katanas
items.lore: Skill of swordsmen from the Land of Reeds. Sheathe blade, holding it at the hip in a composed stance. Follow up with a normal or strong attack to perform a swift slash attack.
items.description: You sheathe your blade and prepare yourself for whatever comes your way. Until you make an attack roll, you have advantage on attacks made as a reaction.

items.name: Spinning Chain
items.applicable_arms: Flails
items.lore: Spins the striking part of a flail at high speed to attack. Follow up with a normal or strong attack to link the momentum of this skill into a successful attack.
items.description: You begin spinning the spiked ball on the end of your flail. Until the end your next turn, when a creature within 5 feet of you makes a melee attack against you, you may make an attack of opportunity against that creature as a reaction.

items.name: Endure
items.applicable_arms: Flails
items.lore: Spins the striking part of a flail at high speed to attack. Follow up with a normal or strong attack to link the momentum of this skill into a successful attack.
items.description: You root yourself firmly in the ground. Until the beginning of your next turn, your movement speed is halved and you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being knocked prone or shoved. In addition, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

items.name: Charge Forth
items.applicable_arms: Twinblades, Heavy Thrusting Swords, Spears, Great Spears, Halberds
items.lore: Quickly charge forward with the armament at the hip, carrying the momentum into a thrust.
items.description: You move up to your movement speed in a straight line without provoking an attack of opportunity and make an attack at advantage at a creature within your reach.

items.name: Barrage
items.applicable_arms: Light Bows
items.lore: Archery skill using a bow held horizontally. Ready the bow, then fire off a rapid succession of shots faster than the eye can see.
items.description: You make an attack roll with this bow at a target within the bowÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s first range increment at disadvantage.

items.name: Mighty Shot
items.applicable_arms: Light Bows, Bows
items.lore: Archery skill performed from an oblique stance. Ready the bow, then pull the bowstring to its limit to enhance the power of the shot, penetrating the enemy's guard.
items.description: You make an attack roll with this bow at a target within the bowÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s first range increment at disadvantage.

items.name: Through and Through
items.applicable_arms: Light Bows, Bows
items.lore: Powerful archery skill using a greatbow held in an oblique stance. Ready the greatbow, then twist the bowstring to fire a mighty greatarrow that can penetrate through enemies.
items.description: You draw the string of your greatbow as far as it will go, firing a greatarrow in a straight line of length equal to the bowÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s first range increment. Make an attack roll against the creature in that line nearest to you. On a hit, the target takes damage as normal and the arrow punctures through them and continues in the line, striking each target in the line. Each target hit reduces the attack roll of the arrow by 1.

items.name: Repeating Thrust
items.applicable_arms: Daggers, Straight Swords, Greatswords, Katanas, Twinblades, Thrusting Swords, Heavy Thrusting Swords, Spears, Great Spears, Halberds
items.lore: Twist to build power, then unleash a flurry of thrusts.
items.description: As part of your Attack action, you may make an additional attack with this weapon.

items.name: Glintstone Pebble
items.applicable_arms: Daggers, Straight Swords, Greatswords, Curved Swords, Curved Greatswords, Katanas, Twinblades, Thrusting Swords, Heavy Thrusting Swords, Spears, Great Spears, Halberds
items.lore: Skill that employs the glintstone sorcery of the same name. Follow up with a strong attack to chain this skill into a lunging thrust, performed while the armament is still imbued with glintstone.
items.description: You cast the Glintstone Pebble sorcery using Intelligence as your spellcasting modifier, immediately followed by an attack made with this weapon at a target within range. Between the spell and attack, you may move up to 5 feet without provoking attacks of opportunity.

items.name: Carian Grandeur
items.applicable_arms: Daggers, Straight Swords, Greatswords, Curved Swords, Curved Greatswords, Katanas, Twinblades, Thrusting Swords, Heavy Thrusting Swords.
items.lore: Carian royal prestige embodied in a skill. Transform the blade into a magical greatsword and swing it down. Can be charged to increase its power.
items.description: As a bonus action, you manifest a magic greatsword from the hilt of this weapon, striking down at an enemy within five feet of you. Make a melee attack roll using your Intelligence modifier. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 force damage. You may activate this ability using an action instead, increasing the range of the the attack to ten feet and the damage to 6d6 force damage.

items.name: Sacred Blade
items.applicable_arms: Daggers, Straight Swords, Greatswords, Colossal Swords, Curved Swords, Curved Greatswords, Katanas, Twinblades, Thrusting Swords, Heavy Thrusting Swords, Hammers, Great Hammers, Axes, Greataxes, Flails, Spears, Great Spears, Halberds, Reapers, Colossal Weapons
items.lore: Grants armament's attacks holy essence and fires off a golden blade projectile. The armament retains its holy essence for a while
items.description: You fire an arc of golden light at a creature within 30 feet of you as a ranged attack with this weapon. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 radiant damage. Until the end of your next turn, your weapon glows brightly with unalloyed gold, and deals an 2d6 radiant damage on a hit.

items.name: Flaming Strike
items.applicable_arms: Daggers, Straight Swords, Greatswords, Curved Swords, Curved Greatswords, Katanas, Twinblades, Thrusting Swords, Heavy Thrusting Swords, Hammers, Great Hammers, Axes, Greataxes, Flails, Spears, Great Spears, Halberds, Reapers, Fists, Claws
items.lore: Skill that emits flame in a wide frontward arc. Follow up with a strong attack to perform a lunging, sweeping strike. This will also coat the armament in fire."
items.description: You summon an arc of flame in a 20-foot cone in front of you. Each creature caught in the area must succeed on a Dexterity Saving Throw against your Affinity DC or take 5d6 fire damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. Until the end of your next turn, this weapon deals an additional 2d6 fire damage.

items.name: LionÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Claw
items.applicable_arms: Straight Swords, Greatswords, Colossal Swords, Curved Swords, Curved Greatswords, Katanas, Twinblades, Hammers, Great Hammers, Axes, Greataxes, Flails, Colossal Weapons
items.lore: Skill of the Redmanes, who fought alongside General Radahn. Somersault forwards, striking foes with armament.
items.description: You move into a somersaulting long jump without provoking attacks of opportunity, making a single attack at advantage at a creature within your reach when you land.

items.name: Vacuum Slice
items.applicable_arms: Daggers, Straight Swords, Greatswords, Colossal Swords, Curved Swords, Curved Greatswords, Katanas, Twinblades, Thrusting Swords, Heavy Thrusting Swords, Axes, Greataxes
items.lore: Lost skill of ancient heroes. Hold the armament aloft to surround it with a shearing vacuum, then launch it forwards as a blade-like projectile.
items.description: You collect wind with your blade and unleash it in a 30-foot line from yourself. Each creature caught in the line must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Affinity DC. A target takes 4d6 slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Golden Vow
items.applicable_arms: All melee armaments
items.lore: Skill passed down from antiquity among the knights of the capital. Raise armament aloft and pledge to honor the Erdtree in battle, granting self and nearby allies increased attack power and defense.
items.description: Up to ten other creatures of your choice within 60 feet of you that can hear you gain advantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Piercing Fang
items.applicable_arms: Straight Swords, Greatswords, Katanas, Twinblades, Thrusting Swords, Heavy Thrusting Swords, Spears, Great Spears, Halberds
items.lore: Skill used by Yura, the Bloody Finger Hunter. Starting with the blade held horizontally, make a powerful thrust that cannot be blocked."
items.description: The next time you take the attack action this turn, you may move 5 feet in any direction without provoking attacks of opportunity. If you do so, the next weapon attack you make this turn has advantage.

items.name: Bloody Slash
items.applicable_arms: Daggers, Straight Swords, Greatswords, Curved Swords, Curved Greatswords, Katanas, Twinblades, Thrusting Swords, Heavy Thrusting Swords
items.lore: Blood Oath skill granted by the Lord of Blood. From a low stance, coat the blade in your own blood to unleash a rending blood slash in a wide arc."
items.description: The attack also gains Bleed 2: When you hit a target with this weapon, they must make a Constitution saving throw against your Affinity DC at the end of the current turn. Each time you hit the target on the same turn increases the DC by 1. On a failure, the creature takes damage equal to 3 of their hit dice. If your weapon already has a Bleed effect, increase that weaponÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s bleed rating by 2 instead during this attack.

items.name: Ground Slam
items.applicable_arms: Daggers, Straight Swords, Greatswords, Colossal Swords, Curved Swords, Curved Greatswords, Katanas, Twinblades, Thrusting Swords, Heavy Thrusting Swords, Hammers, Great Hammers, Axes, Greataxes, Flails, Spears, Great Spears, Halberds, Reapers, Fists, Claws, Whips, Colossal Weapons
items.lore: Jump up high into the air and crash down on the ground ahead. The resulting pratfall sends a powerful shockwave in all directions"
items.description: You jump into the air and crash into the ground. Each creature within ten feet of you must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your affinity DC or take 2d8 bludgeoning damage. Large or smaller creatures that fail the save are also knocked prone. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw takes half damage and is not knocked prone.

items.name: Battleaxe
items.lore: Commonly known as a hatchet, this smaller variety of axe is an everyday work tool. Despite its short reach, it is easy to handle, excelling in successive attacks.
items.skill_description: When you make your first Attack on Your Turn, you can decide to Attack recklessly. Doing so gives you advantage on melee weapon Attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but Attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

items.name: Soldier's Crossbow
items.lore: An unconventional ballistic device modeled on a weapon used to besiege castles. Only capable of firing greatbolts. Perfect for reckless acts such as storming a castle or facing an entire army alone.
items.skill_description: While wielding this weapon, you have advantage on shove attacks made to push an enemy away from you.

items.name: Longbow
items.lore: Longbow made to fire arrows over great distances. Compared to a shortbow, arrows fired reach further and deal more damage.
items.skill_description: As a bonus action, you prepare a well placed shot with this bow. The next attack roll you make with this bow this turn is made at advantage.

items.name: Hookclaws
items.lore: Weapon worn on the fist comprised of sharp parallel blades favored by those who lurk in the dark. Claw weapons come in pairs, and two-handing this weapon will equip it to both hands.
items.skill_description: As a bonus action, you move up to 5 feet in any direction without provoking attacks of opportunity.

items.name: Greatsword
items.lore: A coarse iron lump of an ultra greatsword. Mows down foes by utilizing its incredible weight. Though handling it likely requires the wielder to have surpassed the realm of the merely human, it is precisely for this reason the weapon is used to slaughter even inhuman foes.
items.skill_description: You stomp on the ground, kicking up dust and bracing yourself. Until the end of your next turn, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being knocked prone or shoved. As an action while you are braced, you can make a single attack roll at advantage with this weapon.

items.name: Duelist's Greataxe
items.lore: Greataxe designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum. A weapon reserved for duelist champions, the charge attack is particularly ferocious.
items.skill_description: As an action, you root yourself firmly in the ground. Until the beginning of your next turn, your movement speed is halved and you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being knocked prone or shoved. In addition, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

items.name: Hand Ballistae
items.lore: A crossbow of simple make, usable by anyone, but lacking in both power and accuracy.
items.skill_description: While wielding this weapon, you have advantage on shove attacks made to push an enemy 5 feet away from you.

items.name: Dismounter
items.lore: This curved greatsword wielded by the brawny sellswords of Kaiden combines the blades of a scimitar with the heft of a hatchet. A difficult to handle weapon that demands much of the wielder's strength and dexterity, but with practice and ability, it can serve as a versatile weapon even on horseback.
items.description: While wielding this weapon, you have advantage on Shove attacks made to knock a rider off of their mount (eg. knocking them prone to force a dismount save).
items.skill_description: As an action, you spin your blade in a circle around you, attacking a number of separate targets equal to your proficiency modifier at disadvantage.

items.name: Scimitar
items.lore: A curved sword with a single-sided blade. Delivers slashing attacks with its sharp blade, but is ineffective against armor and hides covered in tough scales. Smaller in size than most curved swords, it carves into enemies with quick, sharp cuts.
items.skill_description: You spin your blade in a circle around you, attacking a number of separate targets equal to your proficiency modifier. These attacks are made at disadvantage.

items.name: Dagger
items.lore: A knife with curved handguards. Designed to parry, turning foes' attacks against them. For masters of combat who anticipate every enemy strike and counter accordingly, this weapon is all they need.
items.skill_description: As a free action you can move up to 5 feet in any direction without provoking attacks of opportunity.

items.name: Flail
items.lore: Weapon consisting of a bludgeoning head attached to a handle by chain. The iron ball is spiked and induces blood loss. Blows from this weapon cannot be parried. The charge attack whirls the iron ball around for increased force before striking.
items.skill_description: As a bonus action, you begin spinning the spiked ball on the end of your flail. Until the end your next turn, when a creature within 5 feet of you makes a melee attack against you, you may make an attack with this weapon at the creature..

items.name: Large Club
items.lore: Greataxe designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum. A weapon reserved for duelist champions, the charge attack is particularly ferocious.
items.skill_description: As a bonus action, you bellow a bestial roar, bolstering yourself. For a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus, your attack and damage rolls with Heavy weapons are increased by 1.

items.name: Lance
items.lore: Considered a type of greatspear, this weapon has no blade, but instead features a long, conical body designed to pierce. Though heavy and hard to wield, this weapon displays its worth in horseback combat whether mounted or even on foot.
items.skill_description: As an action, you move up to your movement speed in a straight line without provoking an attack of opportunity and make an attack at advantage at a creature within your reach.

items.name: Great Epee
items.lore: Large rapier featuring a thin, sharp blade. Commonly used in life or death duels. Like its smaller counterparts, it is made for thrusting attacks, and can be used while guarding with a shield.
items.skill_description: As a bonus action, you keenly thrust your blade between an opponent's guard. Until the beginning of your next turn, attacks you make with this weapon ignore the AC bonus of shields the target wields.

items.name: Greataxe
items.lore: Greataxe akin to a huge lump of iron. Recognized as the weapon of choice of badland chieftains. Too heavy to be wielded by those of merely ordinary strength, blows from this axe will flatten enemies, and the force of its charged attack is a sight to behold.
items.skill_description: As a bonus action, you bellow a bestial roar, bolstering yourself. For a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus, your attack and damage rolls with Heavy weapons are increased by 1.

items.name: Greatbow
items.lore: Enormous greatbow larger than any man. Can not be drawn with any ordinary level of strength, but the force of its shots is extraordinary. A greatbow can only fire great arrows.
items.skill_description: As an action, you draw the string of your greatbow as far as it will go, firing a greatarrow in a straight line of length equal to the bowâ€™s first range increment. Make an attack roll against the creature in that line nearest to you. On a hit, the target takes damage as normal and the arrow punctures through them and continues in the line, striking each target in the line. Each target hit reduces the attack roll of the arrow by 1.

items.name: Claymore
items.lore: A large sword with a long, straight blade. This heavy sword is usually wielded with two hands, but for those with enough strength, one is sufficient. In addition to the heavy sweeping attacks, it can also make a heavy piercing thrust making this a versatile weapon.
items.skill_description: You move up to 5 feet into a somersaulting long jump without provoking attacks of opportunity, making a single attack at advantage at a creature within your reach when you land.

items.name: Halberd
items.lore: A long-handled polearm that combines the functions of both axe and spear. Can be used to press a single enemy with continuous thrusting attacks or swept at groups, taking advantage of its great reach and cleaving blade. A versatile weapon for any situation.
items.skill_description: As an action, you move up to your movement speed in a straight line without provoking an attack of opportunity and make an attack at advantage at a creature within your reach.

items.name: Club
items.lore: A thick, solid lump of wood. Wielding this striking weapon requires no skill. A simple, primitive weapon that requires only brute strength and persistence to hammer your foe into the ground.
items.skill_description: As a bonus action, you bellow a bestial roar, bolstering yourself. For a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus, your attack and damage rolls with Heavy weapons are increased by 1.

items.name: Uchigatana
items.lore: A katana with a long single-edged curved blade. A unique weapon wielded by the samurai from the Land of Reeds. The blade, with its undulating design, boasts extraordinary sharpness, and its slash attacks cause blood loss.
items.skill_description: As a bonus action, you sheathe your blade and prepare yourself for whatever comes your way. Until you make an attack roll, you have advantage on attacks made as a reaction.

items.name: Shortbow
items.lore: Small bow made to fire arrows over great distances. Other than its ability to fire off arrows in rapid succession, it is also well-suited for use on horseback.
items.skill_description: As a bonus action, you make an attack roll with this bow at a target within this bowâ€™s first range increment at disadvantage.

items.name: Rapier
items.lore: A piercing sword with a sharp, slender blade. In addition to this weapon's thrusting attack prowess, it also boasts the ability to be used while guarding with a shield. As one of the smaller piercing swords, quick successive thrust area easy to perform, but without a cutting edge, it cannot be used for slashing attacks.
items.skill_description: As a bonus action, you keenly thrust your blade between an opponents guard. Until the beginning of your next turn, attacks you make with this weapon ignore the AC bonus of shields the target wields.

items.name: Scythe
items.lore: Large scythe featuring a long, slender blade. Designed to reap, this weapon is capable of rapidly inflicting blood loss while also slipping through an enemy's guard. In the hands of a highly dexterous wielder it is capable of striking fear into the heart of any foe.
items.skill_description: You spin your blade in a circle around you, attacking a number of separate targets equal to your proficiency modifier at disadvantage.

items.name: Short Spear
items.lore: An exceedingly plain spear of modest weight. Simple to wield compared to many of its peers, its strong attack unleashes a series of successive piercing thrusts.
items.skill_description: As a bonus action, you keenly thrust your blade between an opponent's guard. Until the beginning of your next turn, attacks you make with this weapon ignore the AC bonus of shields the target wields.

items.name: Longsword
items.lore: A straight sword with a double-edged blade. In addition to its easily-inflicted standard damage, this well-balanced weapon can also perform powerful piercing attacks.
items.skill_description: As a bonus action, you enter a prepared stance until the beginning of your next turn. While prepared, you may make an attack of opportunity against any creature who enters your reach.

items.name: Twinblade
items.lore: A sword with blades on both sides of the hilt. This weapon is difficult to wield, and requires high dexterity.
items.skill_description: You spin your blade in a circle around you, attacking a number of separate targets equal to your proficiency modifier at disadvantage.

items.name: Whip
items.lore: A leather whip. Not originally used for combat, but as an instrument of pain. Its supple attacks cannot be thwarted by parrying or even guarding
items.skill_description: While wielding this weapon, you have advantage on shove attacks made to push an enemy 5 feet away from you.

items.name: Caestus
items.lore: A weapon built for striking with the fists, made of tough leather inlaid with iron rivets. Fist weapons come in pairs, and two-handing this weapon will equip it to both hands.
items.skill_description: As an action, you root yourself firmly in the ground. Until the beginning of your next turn, your movement speed is halved and you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being knocked prone or shoved. In addition, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

items.name: Throwing Knife
items.lore: Short dagger for throwing. It has no handguard. The blade is polished, and its weight is expertly balanced. This auxiliary weapon, used primarily to constrain an enemy's movements, can still be deadly in the right hands.

items.name: Torch
items.lore: This torch's tip is wrapped in oil-soaked rags and set on fire. The flame can illuminate dark locales, or used to attack enemies.
items.description: The flame of this torch burns eternal, but can be snuffed or lit as an action.

items.name: Incantation Scarab
items.lore: Golden scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of incantations during their labors. Slightly reduces the FP costs of incantations, but increases damage taken. As a scarab approaches death, it abandons its rolled treasure and stretches its wings wide for long journey to its home nest.
items.desc: Cursed. This scarab opens itâ€™s wearers flesh to harm, giving it vulnerability to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage while worn.

items.name: Flask of Crimson Tears
items.lore: A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. The one washed up on the gravesite was sure to die, until this flask offered its gift of rejuvenation. To seek the Elden Ring.

items.name: Flask of Cerulean Tears
items.lore: A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with cerulean tears, this flask restores SP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. The one washed up on the gravesite was sure to die, until this flask offered its gift of rejuvenation. To seek the Elden Ring.
items.desc: While you rest at a Site of Grace, you can move charges to and from the Flask of Crimson Tears and the Flask of Cerulean tears as part of a long rest. You may also reinforce the flask with golden seeds and sacred tears. When you do so, the Flask of Cerulean Tears is reinforced simultaneously. Each sacred tear you offer to the flasks increases the healing you receive when you drink it by 2 SP.

items.name: Stonesword Key
items.lore: A sword-shaped stone key. Breaks the seal on imp statues, but remains embedded in the statue after use, meaning it can only be used once as an item. Think well before using one.

items.name: Spirit Calling Bell
items.lore: A bell capable of summoning various spirits from ashen remains. It usually requires SP to use.
items.desc: When you summon a spirit from a Spirit Ash, the ash itself becomes inert and cannot be used to summon the same spirit again. A Spirit Ash can be rejuvenated with the use of a Spirit Tuner.

items.name: Spectral Steed Whistle
items.lore: A delicate goldwork ring. Can be used as a finger whistle. Sound the whistle to summon and ride Torrent, the spectral steed. (Dismounts steed when used while on horseback.) Upon his death, the spectral steed can be summoned again, but doing so drains the Flask of Crimson Tears
items.desc: If Torrent is reduced to 0 hit points, he vanishes immediately. The whistle can be used to summon Torrent afterwards by expending a charge of the *flask of crimson tears*.
